Students API - WORK IN PROGRESS#

This page highlights the different endpoints that are available to the web interface to interact with student data and before-care/after-care services data.

Usage#

GET /api/v1/students#

An endpoint that retrieves all the students from the database and formats it into a list.

Status Codes

  • 200 OK – When the list of students is successfully retrieved from the database.

Example request:

GET /api/v1/students HTTP/1.1

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": 200,
  "message": "success",
  "data": {
      "students": [
          {
              "student_id": "jjerome4",
              "first_name": "Jason",
              "last_name": "Jerome",
              "is_enabled": true,
              "entry_created": "2022-03-01T20:40:03"
          }
      ]
  }
}
GET /api/v1/students/count#

An endpoint that counts the number of students registered in the database and returns it in the response.

Status Codes

  • 200 OK – When the total number of students is successfully retrieved from the database.

Example request:

GET /api/v1/students/count HTTP/1.1

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": 200,
  "message": "success",
  "data": {
      "count": 2
  }
}
POST /api/v1/students/new#

An endpoint that creates a new student in the database given a valid first and last name.

Parameters

  • first_name – The first name of the new student.

  • last_name – The last name of the new student.

Status Codes

  • 201 Created – When the new student is successfully added to the database.

  • 400 Bad Request – When the first or last name of the new student is invalid, or the student already exists in the database

Example request:

POST /api/v1/students HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "first_name": "Jason",
  "last_name": "Jerome"
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 201 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": 201,
  "message": "success",
  "data": {
      "student": {
          "student_id": "jjerome5",
          "first_name": "Jason",
          "last_name": "Jerome",
          "is_enabled": true,
          "entry_created": "2022-03-01T20:46:14"
      }
  }
}
POST /api/v1/students/checkin#

An endpoint that creates a new student in the database given a valid first and last name. KNOWN ERRORS: Currently a successful student check in returns a status 500 error even though the student was successfully checked in.

Parameters

  • student_id – The student ID of the student.

  • check_in_date – The date that the student is checked in to the care service.

  • care_type – The type of care the student is registered to indicated by ‘false’ for before-care, and ‘true’ for after-care.

Status Codes

  • 200 OK – When the student is successfully checked in to the chosen service.

  • 400 Bad Request – When the request body contains invalid parameters, or the student is already checked in to the chosen service for the day.

Example request:

POST /api/v1/students HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "student_id": "jjerome4",
  "check_in_date": "2022-02-20",
  "care_type": false
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": 200,
  "message": "success",
  "data": {
      "student": {
          "student_id": "jjerome5",
          "first_name": "Jason",
          "last_name": "Jerome",
          "check_in_date": "2022-02-20",
          "check_in_time": "20:46:14",
          "check_out_time": null,
          "care_type": false,
          "entry_created": "2022-02-20T20:46:14"
      }
  }
}

Implementation Documentation#

This module consists of FastAPI routing for Students. This handles all the REST API logic for creating, destroying, and updating student-related data.

class server.web_api.routing.v1.student_routing.StudentsRouter#

Bases: object

The API router responsible for defining endpoints relating to students. The defined endpoints allow HTTP requests to conduct create, read, update, and delete tasks on student records.

class Create#

Bases: object

async static create_new_student(pyd_student: server.lib.data_classes.student.PydanticStudentRegistration, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint that creates a new student record and adds it to the students’ table in the database.

Parameters

  • pyd_student (PydanticStudentRegistration, required) – The new student’s first name, last name, carpool number, parent full name, parent primary email, student grade, and optional parameters like parent secondary email and enabling email notifications.

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to create a new student record in the database.

Returns

A response model containing the student object that was created and inserted into the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the request body contains any invalid parameters, or the data provided is formatted incorrectly.

class Delete#

Bases: object

async static delete_student(student_id: str, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint to remove a student record from the student’s table in the database. Removal of a student using this endpoint will permanently delete the student record from the database and all records related to the student record in other tables through a cascading delete.

Parameters

  • student_id (str, required) – The ID of the student that needs to be deleted.

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to delete the student record.

Returns

A response model containing the student object that was deleted from the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the provided request body contains an invalid student ID, or if the student does not exist in the database.

async static delete_students(student_ids: server.lib.data_classes.student.PydanticStudentsRemoval, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint to remove multiple student records from the student’s table in the database. Removal of multiple students using this endpoint will permanently delete the student records from the database and all records related to the student records in other tables through a cascading delete. To remove multiple student records, the student IDs must be provided in a list.

Parameters

  • student_ids (PydanticStudentsRemoval, required) – A list of IDs of students that needs to be deleted.

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to delete the student record.

Returns

A response model containing the student object that was deleted from the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the provided request body contains an invalid student ID, or if the student does not exist in the database.

class Read#

Bases: object

async static read_all_students(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint that retrieves all the students from the database.

Parameters

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to retrieve all student records.

Returns

List of all the students in the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

async static read_one_student(student_id: str, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint that retrieves a single student from the database.

Parameters

  • student_id (str, required) – The ID of the student.

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to retrieve a single student record.

Returns

A single student from the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

async static read_students_count(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint that counts the number of students that are registered in the database.

Parameters

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to retrieve the number of student records.

Returns

A response model containing the number of students in the database. The count will be 0 if there are no students registered in the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

class Update#

Bases: object

async static update_multiple_students(multi_student_update: server.lib.data_classes.student.PydanticMultipleStudentsUpdate, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint that updates multiple students from the database from the provided employee information and employee ID.

Parameters

  • multi_student_update (PydanticMultipleStudentsUpdate, required) – A dictionary that consists of pairs of student IDs and update information as per the PydanticStudentUpdate parameters.

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to update multiple student data.

Returns

A response model containing the multiple student updated data in the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the authentication token is invalid or the students could not be updated.

async static update_one_student(student_id: str, student_update: server.lib.data_classes.student.PydanticStudentUpdate, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), session=Depends(get_db_session))#

An endpoint that updates a single student from the database from the provided student information and student ID.

Parameters

  • student_id (str, required) – The ID of the student.

  • student_update (PydanticStudentUpdate, required) – The ID of the student and any other student information that needs to be updated.

  • token (str, required) – The JSON Web Token responsible for authenticating the user to this endpoint.

  • session (sqlalchemy.orm.session, optional) – The database session to use to update the student data.

Returns

A response model containing the student updated in the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the authentication token is invalid or the student could not be updated.
